articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwanese companies should assume their social responsibilities and play a "positive role" in promoting the peaceful development of relations across the Taiwan Strait, China's government said on Wednesday, amid a probe into major Apple supplier Foxconn.
articles.title: Amid Foxconn probe, China tells Taiwan firms to play positive role in ties

articles.author: Tom Westbrook
articles.description: China led Asia's stock markets higher on Wednesday as investors cheered the approval of a trillion-yuan sovereign bond issue as a harbinger of stimulus, while the Aussie dollar hit a two-week high as hotter-than-expected inflation lifted rate forecasts.
articles.title: Asian stocks bounce on China spending plans; inflation jolts Aussie

articles.author: Hadeel Sayegh, Rachna Uppal
articles.description: Wall Street's top financiers struck a pessimistic tone about the global economy at a flagship gathering in Saudi Arabia aimed at deal brokering, as a violent conflict between Israel and Hamas that has killed thousands of people unfolds.
articles.title: As Israel-Hamas war rages, global finance chiefs in Saudi sound gloomy note

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: California's auto regulator said on Tuesday it has suspended General Motors' (GM.N) Cruise autonomous vehicle deployment and driverless testing permits, saying it had misrepresented information related to the safety of the autonomous technology.
articles.title: California suspends GM Cruise self-driving vehicles as 'not safe' for public

articles.author: Stella Qiu
articles.description: Australian inflation was surprisingly strong in the third quarter amid broad-based and stubborn cost pressures, a headache for policymakers that added greatly to the risk of a rise in interest rates as early as next month.
articles.title: Australia Q3 inflation surprisingly strong, adds to rate hike risk

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: Mac computer and iPhone maker Apple (AAPL.O) on Tuesday will announce plans to make parts, tools and documentation needed to repair its products available to independent repair shops and consumers nationwide, at fair and reasonable prices, the White House said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Apple to make tools and parts to fix phones, computers available nationwide - White House

articles.author: Stephen Nellis
articles.description: Qualcomm (QCOM.O) on Tuesday gave details about a chip for Microsoft (MSFT.O) Windows-based laptops that it claims will be faster at some tasks than Apple's (AAPL.O) chips for Mac computers.
articles.title: Qualcomm unveils new PC laptop chip with AI features for 2024

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: Countries including the United States, Canada, Russia and Arab states pushed for either a pause or ceasefire in fighting between Israel and Hamas in the Gaza Strip so that humanitarian aid could be delivered to besieged Palestinian civilians, and late on Tuesday eight trucks with water, food and medicine entered the enclave from Egypt.
articles.title: World leaders seek to suspend Israel-Hamas fighting for Gaza aid

articles.author: Janis Laizans
articles.description: An elderly Israeli hostage who was released by Hamas overnight said she had been beaten by militants when she was abducted and taken to Gaza on Oct. 7, but was then treated well during her two-week captivity in the Palestinian enclave.
articles.title: Freed Israeli hostage says 'I've been through hell'

articles.author: David Shepardson, Steve Gorman
articles.description: An off-duty pilot charged with trying to disable the engines of an Alaska Airlines jet in flight told police afterward he was suffering a nervous breakdown, had taken psychedelic mushrooms two days earlier and had not slept in 40 hours, court documents showed on Tuesday.
articles.title: Alaska Air pilot in aborted flight said he used 'magic' mushrooms, documents show
